title: How to Make Freezer Bag Omelettes

steps.headline: Claim your bag.
steps.description: Each person takes 1 US-quart (950 ml) size freezer bag and writes their name on it using a permanent marker.

steps.headline: Add two eggs.
steps.description: Add two eggs to each freezer bag.

steps.headline: Add your fixings.
steps.description: Add 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of each of your desired omelette ingredients.

steps.headline: Seal and mix.
steps.description: Seal the bag up tightly, making sure most of the air is out. Shake the contents of the bag repeatedly until the eggs and ingredients are well incorporated.

steps.headline: Boil and serve.
steps.description: Add the bags to a large pot of boiling water. Make sure the plastic is completely submerged and not touching the hot metal on the sides. Boil for 13-15 minutes. Remove the bags and allow them to cool. Slide the cooked omelette onto a plate. Repeat as many times as necessary and enjoy!

text: Claim your bag. Each person takes 1 US-quart (950 ml) size freezer bag and writes their name on it using a permanent marker. Add two eggs. Add two eggs to each freezer bag. Add your fixings. Add 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of each of your desired omelette ingredients. Seal and mix. Seal the bag up tightly, making sure most of the air is out. Shake the contents of the bag repeatedly until the eggs and ingredients are well incorporated. Boil and serve. Add the bags to a large pot of boiling water. Make sure the plastic is completely submerged and not touching the hot metal on the sides. Boil for 13-15 minutes. Remove the bags and allow them to cool. Slide the cooked omelette onto a plate. Repeat as many times as necessary and enjoy!
